description: ), 3BR, 840, Hello all!One private medium-sized unfurnished bedroom available in a very spacious 3-4bd,  artsy,  furnished ground floor apt,  with 2 roommates. Rent includes ALL utilities,  even high speed cable internet. The room is unfurnished,  available starting June 1. Ending July 31st,  preferably,  but if you need to stay in August,  this is possible.Stop & Shop is maybe a 4 min walk,  there are tons of restaurants on Broadway,  the amazing Sarma is nearby,  even more restaurants in Assembly Sq (10-12 min walk) and Union Sq (15 min walk),  and Sullivan Sq Station is a reasonable walk (12 min) but there are also 3 frequent busses nearby (89,  90,  101) that'll get you there even faster. There's no laundry in the building,  but there's a cheap laundromat a block and a half away. Parking is EASY if you have resident parking. I have always been able to find parking super close by. We also have an overnight guest parking pass available for up to 2 nights at a time.We are friendly and very low maintenance as a household. I'm a professional classical musician,  and will sometimes be practicing in the apt in the music/guest room. We have friends over sometimes for dinner and movies. We want the vibe to be respectful,  and the common areas to remain looking nice,  but we also wanna make sure we can all relax,  enjoy ourselves and not walk on eggshells - it's a pretty laid back place. Be nice,  keep messes mostly in your room,  we'll get along great :-)First and last required to move in for a total cost to move in of $1680,  month to month agreement,  either party must give at the very least 30 days notice to terminate agreement.Note: Seeking young professional who thinks this would be a good fit. I am holding some in person meetings this Saturday 4/16 between 2pm and 7pm and can on Sunday as well. Please email me a time that works for you on either day as well as telling me some about about yourself if you are interested. Cat picture is completely unrelated,  I just think it's adorable.I look forward to meeting you!

description: ), 3BR, 4000, ID: 1311936Location: Massachusetts,  Boston (South End)Rent: $4000 / MonthBroker Fee: One MonthAvailable Date: September 1stBeds: 3Baths: 1Pet: No PetFeatures: Parking For RentThis large three bedroom,  one bathroom apartment is renovated with granite countertops,  stainless steel appliances and a new tile bathroom. The apartment has a private washer and dryer,  dishwasher,  garbage disposal,  central air conditioning and hardwood floors throughout. The apartment has a high efficiency gas furnace and hot water heater as well as a central air conditioning system.The soaring ceilings and exposed brick provide an uncompromised balance of historic and traditional ambiance. There is onsite/off street parking available as an extra.The building,  which was originally constructed in 1865 as a single family home,  has undergone a complete restoration converting the structure into a super-luxury apartment complex. The entire building has been retrofitted with a high efficiency heating system,  central air conditioning and instant hot water heaters. All the windows in the structure have been replaced with brand new custom,  historically accurate,  high efficiency windows. The latest in insulation technology,  closed cell spray in,  has been installed to minimize the heat loss in the winter and heat gain in the summer.The location is near the corner of Massachusetts Avenue and Washington Street,  the heart of 'restaurant row' in Boston's South End. A few of the restaurants which are a stone's throw away include Turo,  Terango,  Seiyo Wine Sushi,  Equator Thai,  Stella and Mike's Dinner. The property is at the heart of multiple transportation options.The Washington Stop on the Silver Line is 200' from the property,  there are five Zip Car stations about ¼ mile away,  7 bus lines pass near the property,  and there are two Hub Way Bike stations nearby.This location offers a multitude of transportation options (silver line,  bus,  zip car,  hub way) and is ideal for medical professionals practicing at the hospital two blocks away,  professionals commuting downtown and students studying at any of the many universities in the direct vicinity. description: $640 (Brighton), 6BR, 640, Room available in a 6BR apartment in Brighton! This spacious room is perfect for the summer,  with 5 large windows lighting it up in the sunny months! It comes fully furnished with a full-sized mattress,  dresser,  bookshelf,  desk,  and end-table,  but if you'd rather bring your own things I can have those removed. The room also comes with your own door to the outside,  leading out to a large backyard perfect for grilling.The apartment is 3 floors,  with a bathroom (with shower) on each floor,  a large kitchen and living room,  and a basement with free (no coins needed) laundry machines,  storage space,  and a room for playing music.The other residents are 5 males in their mid-20s,  mostly restaurant/bar workers and one 9-5er,  and most are also musicians. They are all very nice and laid-back people who like to hang out and watch movies or play video games,  but if you wanna do your own thing nobody will bother you.Very short walk to the 86 and 70 buses for getting to Brookline,  Watertown,  Cambridge,  and Somerville. Also within short walking distance of a plaza containing a Star Market and a few small restaurants including McDonalds,  Jimmy Johns,  and a nice diner called Breakfast Club. You'll also be very near Brighton center and Allston,  both of which contain many restaurants,  bars,  shops,  and music venues.Rent is $640/month,  with utilities around $50/month.The sublet is until the end of August but can be renewed if you're interested!

description: : 1 BR/1 Bath near Inman Sq (Cambridge / Somerville), 1BR, 1100, I am looking to sublet my bed- and bathroom in a very large and airy (1250 sqft) 2-bed 2-bath apartment right across from Whole Foods in Inman Sq.The room comes with your own full bathroom and a large walk-in closet and is available from mid-May until late August (start date is negotiable). Rent is $1, 100/mo. plus utilities,  which are around $50/mo. in the summer.The bedroom:- is very large (12'8 x 12'1) and bright- comes fully furnished (bed,  desk,  chair,  shelving,  etc.)- has lots of storage space (fully built-out walk-in closet with shelves and overhead space)- is very quiet (back of the building,  no traffic)- has a built-in wall air conditioning unitThe apartment is on the 2nd floor,  has in-unit laundry (free!),  large and bright living and dining rooms,  kitchen with lots of cabinet storage,  dishwasher & microwave,  and modern appliances. The entertainment area is very separate from the bedrooms so sleep and chatting with guests can co-exist happily.Your roommate would be a young (female) professional,  who frequently travels for work. The in-house neighbors are young working professionals and families.The location is within a easy 3-min bike/12-min walk to Harvard and a short bus ride from MIT. It is highly residential but has dozens of great restaurants,  coffee shops,  and bars within a few blocks. Whole Foods is right across the street and a cheaper large supermarket a short bike ride away. If you are bringing a bike,  we have a private bike rack away from the sidewalk.I'm attaching some pictures,  feel free to contact with questions or to request some additional pictures.

description: ), 1BR, 1800, Our very comfortable one bedroom apartment in South Boston with everything you will need while away from your own home. Bedroom has queen size bed with all linens provided. Kitchen comes fully stocked by two people who love to cook and we have a full dining table for 6. Living room features a decorative fireplace,  exposed brick and built in book shelves for lots of charm but also has a wireless Bose sound system and flat screen TV with basic cable and Apple TV.There are two private decks for you to enjoy. The back deck off of the bedroom has a cute seating area for a couple people. The roof deck allows a big,  relaxing outdoor dinner and beautiful Boston skyline views. Finally,  there is a private washer and dryer in the basement for your use.The apartment is located mere steps from the local 9 bus that will bring you right to the redline train (called the T) or directly into the Back Bay for sight seeing. Many other buses available a couple blocks away that will take you downtown. And remember,  Boston is a very walkable city! If you are coming with a car there is ample free parking on the street and right outside of the apartment.

description: ), 1BR, 900, Three of the coolest people you'll ever meet are looking for a fourth to make our home complete this May!One of our roommates will be romping around Europe this May,  which means that we're eager to find someone to fill her spot. We live in a beautiful 4 bedroom,  2 bathroom house by Davis Square. $900 for this May sublet. Utilities and internet are $50 - $150 depending on temperatures but we are willing to discuss how this would be worked in to the cost. Move-in and move-out dates are relatively flexible,  but move-in must happen after May 1st and move-out must happen by May 31st.A bit about the house and your room:- The open room will come furnished with a bed,  dresser,  bedside table,  lamps,  mirrors,  laundry basket. There was also be closet space. Sheets and pillows are available if necessary!- 2 full bathrooms (you would primarily share the one pictured,  which is next to the bedroom)- Full kitchen with a closet pantry and small mud room for cleaning supplies- Living room with cable and Apple TV (Netflix,  HBO,  Showtime)- A front porch,  beautiful park directly across from us,  and a backyard as well- Large and brand new washer and dryer in the basement- No off-street parking but plenty of street parking right outside with a Somerville permitA bit about the location:- Bus stop for the 80,  89 and 96 practically right outside of the house- 10 minute walk from the Davis Square T and downtown Davis in general- Minutes from Ball Square Cafe,  Dunkin Donuts,  and plenty of restaurants,  coffee shops,  pubs,  a convenience store,  liquor stores,  and hair dressers- Directly across from the gorgeous,  well-kept Nathan Tufts Park and the Tufts University campusA bit about us:- The three girls you'll share the home with work full-time and also take classes part-time. If and when they are home,  they're likely hanging out in the living room doing homework/watching TV or making dinner. Otherwise,  the house tends to be relatively quiet - although you should feel comfortable having friends over :)- LGBT and moderate-drinking friendly. Please inquire about any other specifics!A bit about you:- A considerate and positive addition to the house- Able and willing to pay $975 upfront for the month- Participatory with household chores- Respectful and considerate of the tenant's room/belongings you'll be utilizingIf this sounds like a good fit,  we want to hear from you please! Reply to this ad with brief introduction and your move in/out dates.We're so excited to hear from you and show you our (your?) home!Angela,  Jacquie,  Brianna and Dana

description: ), 1BR, 1800, This Furnished One bedroom/one bathroom apartment is Located in the heart of Boston's Waterfront District.Everything you want in Boston,  and more. The vibrant Waterfront District,  where Atlantic Wharf is located,  runs from the North End to South Station and is marked on two sides by Boston's most iconic natural landmarks- Boston Harbor and the Rose Kennedy Greenway. With the beauty of the harbor and greenway running almost its entire length,  the Waterfront District is where Boston's top five-star hotels,  premier waterfront residences,  and marquee office headquarters mingle with the excitement and nightlife of the North End,  Faneuil Hall Marketplace,  and the waterfront. The city's top dining,  historic,  and cultural attractions are in the Waterfront District,  and at your doorstep at Atlantic Wharf. All with close proximity and easy access to highways,  public transportation,  parking and Logan Airport. It is Boston living,  at its best.

$875,  June thru August 2016 (Commonwealth Avenue), 1BR, 875, Spacious room for rent right on Commonwealth Avenue. The apartment will be shared with two other young professionals. The apartment also includes a furnished living room,  one bathroom,  and full kitchen. The apartment is on the second floor of the building. There is a laundry room available for use in the basement of the building that is coin-operated. The room will be available for rent from June through August 2016.
